org.chronos.chronodb.internal.api.index

Interface IndexManagerBackend

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend, ChunkDbIndexManagerBackend, DocumentBasedChunkIndex, InMemoryIndexManagerBackend, JdbcIndexManagerBackend, MapDBIndexManagerBackend, TuplIndexManagerBackend

    public interface IndexManagerBackend
    Some index managers delegate calls to a backend, which is an implementation of this interface.

    This class primarily exists in order to avoid excessive inheritance in IndexManager implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • loadIndexersFromPersistence

        com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.String,Indexer<?>> loadIndexersFromPersistence()
        Loads the multimap of "index name to indexers" from the storage backend.
        Returns:
        The multimap of "index name to indexers". May be empty, but never null.

      • persistIndexers

        void persistIndexers(com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.String,Indexer<?>> indexNameToIndexers)
        Persists the given multimap of "index name to indexers" in the storage backend.
        Parameters:
        indexNameToIndexers - The multimap to store. Must not be null.

      • persistIndexer

        void persistIndexer(java.lang.String indexName,
                    Indexer<?> indexer)
        Persists the given index name and indexer.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The index name on which the indexer operates. Must not be null.
        indexer - The indexer to store. Must not be null.

      • deleteIndexAndIndexers

        void deleteIndexAndIndexers(java.lang.String indexName)
        Deletes the index with the given name, as well as all Indexers bound to it.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index to delete. Must not be null.

      • deleteAllIndicesAndIndexers

        void deleteAllIndicesAndIndexers()
        Deletes all index names, index contents and Indexers.

      • loadIndexStates

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> loadIndexStates()
        Loads the mapping of "index name to dirty flag" from the storage backend.
        Returns:
        The "index name to dirty flag" mapping. May be empty, but never null.

      • persistIndexDirtyStates

        void persistIndexDirtyStates(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> indexNameToDirtyFlag)
        Persists the given "index name to dirty flag" mapping in the storage backend.
        Parameters:
        indexNameToDirtyFlag - The map to store in the storage backend. Must not be null.

      • rollback

        void rollback(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
              long timestamp)
        Performs a rollback to the given timestamp of all the indices in the given branches.
        Parameters:
        branches - The names of the branches on which to perform the index rollback. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative.

      • rollback

        void rollback(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches,
              long timestamp,
              java.util.Set<QualifiedKey> keys)
        Performs a rollback to the given timestamp of all the indices in the given branches, restricted to the documents with the given keys.
        Parameters:
        branches - The names of the branches on which to perform the index rollback. Must not be null.
        timestamp - The timestamp to roll back to. Must not be negative.
        keys - The keys to roll back. Must not be null.
